edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator
Class RobotController

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator.RobotController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Controller, java.lang.Runnable
public abstract class RobotController
extends java.lang.Object
implements Controller

A RobotController is an abstract class that should be extended by any controller written for the WSU Kephera Simulator. This class provides the interface to the simulator and contains the threading construct used to execute the controller.

Constructor Summary
RobotController()
          Allocates a new RobotController object.

Constructor Detail

RobotController

public RobotController()
Allocates a new RobotController object.

Method Detail

initialize

protected void initialize(java.lang.String name,
                          CurrentRobotState currentRobotState)
This method should only be used by the simulator. This method is used by the simulator to initialize this controller with references to the local simulator. Also a Thread object is created to execute this RobotCcontroller.

Parameters:
name - the name of this controller
currentRobotState - a reference to the current robot state

setWaitTime

protected void setWaitTime(long waitTime)
This method is used by the controller to set the delay before the next execution of the doWork method. The delay is usually set in the controllers constructor. After the doWork method finishes the execution thread will wait for the specified amount of time to elapse before executing doWork again. The default delay time is 5 milliseconds.

Parameters:
waitTime - the wait time in milliseconds

setFinished

protected void setFinished(boolean finished)
This method is used by the simulator in order to tell this controller to stop running. This allows for a graceful termination of this controller thread.

Parameters:
finished - set this flag true to terminate the controller

isRunning

protected boolean isRunning()
This method is used by the simulator to check if the controller is currently running. In this context running means the controller thread could be executing the doWork method or in between doWork calls.

Returns:
true if this controller is running

run

public void run()
This method should not be called by the controller

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
See Also:
Runnable

sleep

public void sleep(long timeout)
This method should be used by the controller if an extra delay is needed at some point in the controllers doWork method. It is very important that this method be used to insert delays rather than the objects wait method, otherwise there could be drastic performance problems.

Parameters:
timeout - the delay time in milliseconds

setMotorSpeeds

public void setMotorSpeeds(int left,
                           int right)
This method is provided so the controller can control the motor speeds of the left and right wheels. The valid range for motor speeds are between the range of 10 and -10, not inclusive.

Parameters:
left - the left wheel speed
right - the right wheel speed

setLeftMotorSpeed

public void setLeftMotorSpeed(int speed)
This method is provided so the controller can control the left motor speed. The valid range for motor speeds are between the range of 10 and -10, not inclusive.

Parameters:
speed - the left wheel speed

setRightMotorSpeed

public void setRightMotorSpeed(int speed)
This method is provided so the controller can control the right motor speed. The valid range for motor speeds are between the range of 10 and -10, not inclusive.

Parameters:
speed - the right wheel speed

getRightWheelPosition

public long getRightWheelPosition()
This method is used to attain the current position of the right wheel. On the actual robot, this information is generated by incrementing/decrementing a counter based on shaft encoder readings.

Returns:
right motor position

getLeftWheelPosition

public long getLeftWheelPosition()
This method is used to attain the current position of the left wheel. On the actual robot, this information is generated by incrementing/decrementing a counter based on shaft encoder readings.

Returns:
left motor position

getGripperState

public int getGripperState()
This method is provided so the controller can check the current state of the robot gripper. The valid states for the gripper are: KSGripperStates.GRIP_OPEN and KSGripperStates.GRIP_CLOSED.

Returns:
the gripper state

setGripperState

public void setGripperState(int state)
This method is provided so the controller can set the gripper state of the robot. The valid states are: KSGripperStates.GRIP_OPEN and KSGripperStates.GRIP_CLOSED.

Parameters:
state - the gripper state

getArmState

public int getArmState()
This method is provided so the controller can check the current state of the robot arm. The valid states for the arm are: KSGripperStates.ARM_UP and KSGripperStates.ARM_DOWN

Returns:
the arm state

setArmState

public void setArmState(int state)
This method is provided so the controller can set the current state of the robot arm. The valid states for the arm are: KSGripperStates.ARM_UP and KSGripperStates.ARM_DOWN

Parameters:
state - the arm state

isObjectPresent

public boolean isObjectPresent()
This method is provided so the controller can check if an object is present inside the gripper.

Returns:
true if an object is present, false otherwise

isObjectHeld

public boolean isObjectHeld()
This method is provided so the controller can check if an object is currently held by the gripper.

Returns:
true if an object is held, false otherwise

getLightValue

public int getLightValue(int sensorID)
This method is provided so the controller can get the light value of a specific sensor given the sensor ID. The sensor ID's range from 0 to 7. TODO: describe where each sensor is located on the robot. TODO: describe the range of light values and meaning of the scale.

Returns:
the light value

getDistanceValue

public int getDistanceValue(int sensorID)
This method is provided so the controller can get the distance value of a specific sensor given the sensor ID. The sensor ID's range from 0 to 7. TODO: describe where each sensor is located on the robot. TODO: describe the range of distance values and meaning of the scale.

Returns:
the distance value

getResistivity

public int getResistivity()
This method is provided so the controller can get the resistivity of the current object between the gripper. This feature has not yet been implemented.

Returns:
the resistivity value
